item.title: Mute and unmute Help
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“duhelis, post:5, topic:347034”]its says you are muted but you can still talk…
you just cant ::yell[/quote]
That is because yell is actually a server-message. Not a regular talk that is broadcasted. The “you are muted” part is also because of the yell command. You need to intercept the chat-packet to mute the talking.

Read full topic

item.title: Mute and unmute Help
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

duhelis:

it works but why player can still talk?

You need to edit the packet that is received when a player says something. Have it check if they are muted, and if so, do nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Mute and unmute Help
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Brandon12111 Mod Brandon12111
item.description:
@Mod_Brandon12111 wrote:

      if (command.startsWith("mute") && playerRights >= 1) {
                try {
                    String otherPName = command.substring(5);
                    int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                    if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                        client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

                        p.muted = true;
			p.disconnected = true;
			writeLog(p.playerName, "mutes");
			sM("You Have Muted "+p.playerName+"!");
                        yell("["+playerName+"] Has Just Muted "+p.playerName+"!");
                         
                    } else { 
                       sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                    }
                } catch (Exception e) { 
                    sM("Try entering a name you want to mute..");
                }
            }

Read full topic

item.title: Mute and unmute Help
item.dc:creator: @duhelis duhelis
item.description:
@duhelis wrote:

i have mute and umute in my server but it nots working…

if (command.startsWith("unmute") && hasRights()) { try { String name = command.substring(7); java.util.List<String> bannedUsers = new java.util.ArrayList<String>(); BufferedReader input = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./config/mutes.txt")); String s; String unbanned = null; while ((s = input.readLine()) != null) { if(!s.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) bannedUsers.add(s); else unbanned = s; } input.close(); BufferedWriter output = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./config/mutes.txt")); for (String s1 : bannedUsers) { output.write(s1); output.newLine(); } output.close(); if(unbanned != null) sM("User "+name+" successfully unmuted."); return; } catch(Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

And could somebody make mute commands?

Read full topic
